card.name: Abundant Growth
card.ability: Enchant land£When Abundant Growth enters the battlefield, draw a card.£Enchanted land has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The enchanted land retains any other abilities it has. Activating one of the land’s activated abilities won’t cause the other(s) to be activated.

card.name: Ancestral Mask
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 for each other enchantment on the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_"I pass to you all we have ever been. Go forth and become all we never could."_#

card.name: Animate Dead
card.ability: Enchant creature card in a graveyard£When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.£Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Animate Dead is an Aura, albeit with an unusual enchant ability. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to the card again (since the card is a new object on the battlefield). Animate Dead itself never moves into a graveyard during this process.£6/8/2016 : If Animate Dead isn’t on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, none of its effects happen. The creature card won’t be returned to the battlefield.£6/8/2016 : Abilities such as shroud and protection function only on the battlefield unless otherwise specified. A creature card with shroud may be targeted by Animate Dead, and Animate Dead will become attached to the creature that enters the battlefield.£6/8/2016 : If the creature put onto the battlefield has protection from black—or if the creature can’t legally be enchanted by Animate Dead for another reason—Animate Dead won’t be able to attach to it. It will be put into the graveyard as a state-based action, causing its delayed triggered ability to trigger. When the trigger resolves, if the creature’s still on the battlefield, its controller will sacrifice it.£6/8/2016 : Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can’t be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won’t work.

card.name: Annihilate
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.£Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"Whatever Yawgmoth marks, dies. There is no escape."£—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target when Annihilate tries to resolve, the entire spell is countered. You won’t draw a card.

card.name: Arcanis the Omnipotent
card.ability: {T}: Draw three cards.£{2}{U}{U}: Return Arcanis the Omnipotent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: #_He has journeyed where none have been before. Now he returns to ensure that none follow._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Arcanis’s last ability can only be activated while it’s on the battlefield.
card.name_JP: 全能なる者アルカニス

card.name: Argothian Enchantress
card.ability: Shroud #_(This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)_#£Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, draw a card.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Argothian Enchantress’s last ability will resolve before the spell that caused it to trigger.£6/8/2016 : If the enchantment spell is countered, Argothian Enchantress’s last ability still resolves and causes you to draw a card.£6/8/2016 : Enchantments put onto the battlefield without being cast won’t cause Argothian Enchantress’s last ability to trigger.

card.name: Armadillo Cloak
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample.£Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: #_"Don't laugh. It works."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : While Armadillo Cloak’s last ability is similar to lifelink, it isn’t lifelink—it’s a normal triggered ability. If a creature you control with lifelink wears an Armadillo Cloak and deals damage, first you’ll gain that much life for lifelink, and then Armadillo Cloak’s triggered ability is put onto the stack. This also means that multiple instances of Armadillo Cloak’s triggered ability do trigger separately.£6/8/2016 : If Armadillo Cloak enchants a creature you don’t control, you’ll gain life when it deals damage, as long as that damage hasn’t already caused you to lose the game.

card.name: Ashnod's Altar
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: #_"If you work at sawing up carcasses, you notice how the joints fit, how the nerves are arrayed, and how the skin peels back."£—Ashnod, to Tawnos_#
card.name_JP: アシュノッドの供犠台

card.name: Avarax
card.ability: Haste£When Avarax enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Avarax, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.£{1}{R}: Avarax gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Aven Riftwatcher
card.ability: Flying£Vanishing 3 #_(This creature enters the battlefield with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)_#£When Aven Riftwatcher enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
card.name_JP: エイヴンの裂け目追い

card.name: Balance
card.ability: Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : First the player whose turn it is chooses which lands (if any) to keep, then each other player in turn order does the same. Each player will know the choices made by the players who chose before them. All of the unchosen lands are then sacrificed simultaneously. Then the process is repeated for cards in hand, except that no cards are revealed until all players have chosen what to discard, at which point those cards are all discarded simultaneously. Lastly, the process is repeated for creatures, and players will again know earlier choices made when deciding what to sacrifice. All of the unchosen creatures are then sacrificed simultaneously.£6/8/2016 : Balance doesn’t have targets, so permanents that can’t be targeted, such as a creature with shroud or protection from white, are valid choices to be sacrificed.£6/8/2016 : Each type of object is counted during the corresponding part of the process. Cards in hand are counted after lands have been sacrificed, and creatures on the battlefield are counted after cards have been discarded. Thus, a land creature sacrificed to the first part of the spell would not be counted when determining how many creatures are on the battlefield for the last part.

card.name: Baleful Strix
card.ability: Flying, deathtouch£When Baleful Strix enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: #_Its beak rends flesh and bone, exposing the tender marrow of dream._#

card.name: Ballynock Cohort
card.ability: First strike£Ballynock Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another white creature.
card.flavor: #_A kithkin's worst enemy is solitude._#

card.name: Battle Squadron
card.ability: Flying£Battle Squadron's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
card.flavor: #_The goblins made an unruly pile with military precision._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Battle Squadron’s last ability applies in all zones. While it’s on the battlefield, it counts itself, so it’ll be at least 1/1.

card.name: Beetleback Chief
card.ability: When Beetleback Chief enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
card.flavor: #_Whether trained, ridden, or eaten, few goblin military innovations have rivaled the bug._#

card.name: Benevolent Bodyguard
card.ability: Sacrifice Benevolent Bodyguard: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"My destiny is to save others so their destinies may be achieved."_#
card.name_JP: 心優しきボディガード

card.name: Blightsoil Druid
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: #_"See the beauty in death: the clean white bones lying in the fertile soil and the brightly colored moonglove sprouting from the fell earth."_#

card.name: Blood Artist
card.ability: Whenever Blood Artist or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: #_"Great art can never be created without great suffering."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If Blood Artist and one or more other creatures die at the same time, its ability will trigger for each of those creatures.

card.name: Bloodbraid Elf
card.ability: Haste£Cascade #_(When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)_#
card.ruling: £5/1/2009 : Cascade triggers when you cast the spell, meaning that it resolves before that spell. If you end up casting the exiled card, it will go on the stack above the spell with cascade.£5/1/2009 : When the cascade ability resolves, you must exile cards. The only optional part of the ability is whether or not you cast the last card exiled.£5/1/2009 : If a spell with cascade is countered, the cascade ability will still resolve normally.£5/1/2009 : You exile the cards face-up. All players will be able to see them.£5/1/2009 : If you exile a split card with cascade, check if at least one half of that split card has a converted mana cost that’s less than the converted mana cost of the spell with cascade. If so, you can cast either half of that split card.£5/1/2009 : If you cast the last exiled card, you’re casting it as a spell. It can be countered. If that card has cascade, the new spell’s cascade ability will trigger, and you’ll repeat the process for the new spell.£5/1/2009 : After you’re done exiling cards and casting the last one if you chose to do so, the remaining exiled cards are randomly placed on the bottom of your library. Neither you nor any other player is allowed to know the order of those cards.

card.name: Bloodfell Caves
card.ability: Bloodfell Caves enters the battlefield tapped.£When Bloodfell Caves enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

card.name: Blossoming Sands
card.ability: Blossoming Sands enters the battlefield tapped.£When Blossoming Sands enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Borderland Marauder
card.ability: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Though she is rightly feared, there are relatively few tales of her deeds in battle, for few survive her raids._#

card.name: Brago, King Eternal
card.ability: Flying£Whenever Brago, King Eternal deals combat damage to a player, exile any number of target nonland permanents you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.
card.flavor: #_"My rule persists beyond death itself."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Brago’s last ability exiles and returns all the targets during the combat damage step, after combat damage is dealt. You can’t target any creature that didn’t survive combat.£6/8/2016 : You may exile and return Brago using its own ability.£6/8/2016 : If you exile an Aura with Brago’s last ability, the Aura’s owner chooses what it will enchant as it comes back onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way doesn’t target anything (so it could be attached to a permanent with shroud, for example), but the Aura’s enchant ability restricts what it can be attached to. The Aura can’t enter the battlefield enchanting a permanent that enters the battlefield at the same time. If the Aura can’t legally be attached to anything, it remains exiled.

card.name: Braids, Cabal Minion
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact, creature, or land.
card.flavor: #_"Home is where you can find a decent graveyard and strangers can disappear without awkward questions."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : At the beginning of your upkeep, triggered abilities you control will resolve after triggered abilities your opponents control. If an opponent controls Braids and you control a triggered ability that puts a permanent onto the battlefield, you won’t be able to sacrifice that permanent to satisfy Braids’s ability.
card.name_JP: 陰謀団の先手ブレイズ

card.name: Brainstorm
card.ability: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
card.flavor: #_The mizzium-sphere array drove her mind deep into the thought field, where only the rarest motes of genius may be plucked._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Brainstorm is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

card.name: Brawn
card.ability: Trample£As long as Brawn is in your graveyard and you control a Forest, creatures you control have trample.
card.flavor: #_"‘I have arrived,' bellowed Brawn, and the plane shuddered."£—Scroll of Beginnings_#

card.name: Burning Vengeance
card.ability: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: #_Mist is the geists' sorrow. Wind is their pain. Fire is their vengeance._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Although flashback and retrace are the most common ways to cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance will trigger whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard through any means.£6/8/2016 : Burning Vengeance doesn’t trigger when you activate an ability of a card in your graveyard, such as unearth or the ability of Reassembling Skeleton.£6/8/2016 : Burning Vengeance’s triggered ability will resolve before the spell you cast from your graveyard.

card.name: Cabal Therapy
card.ability: Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that name.£Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You name the card as Cabal Therapy resolves, not as you cast it. Then the targeted player reveals his or her hand and discards if appropriate. No player may choose to take actions between you naming the card and the targeted player revealing and discarding.

card.name: Calciderm
card.ability: Shroud #_(This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)_#£Vanishing 4 #_(This creature enters the battlefield with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)_#
card.ruling: £2/1/2007 : This is the timeshifted version of Blastoderm.

card.name: Call the Skybreaker
card.ability: Create a 5/5 blue and red Elemental creature token with flying.£Retrace #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)_#
card.flavor: #_It hears and answers every orison across Shadowmoor._#
card.ruling: £8/1/2008 : Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other spell, with two exceptions: You’re casting it from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.£8/1/2008 : A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.£8/1/2008 : When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves or is countered, it’s put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.£8/1/2008 : If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so he or she can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it’s still in the graveyard.

card.name: Carbonize
card.ability: Carbonize deals 3 damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
card.flavor: #_"There's no coming back from that."£—Jaya Ballard_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The targeted creature can’t be regenerated and is exiled if it would die no matter why it would die this turn. It doesn’t have to be destroyed because of the damage Carbonize deals to it.

card.name: Carrion Feeder
card.ability: Carrion Feeder can't block.£Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Carrion Feeder.
card.flavor: #_Stinking of rot, it leaps between gravestones in search of its next meal._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You can sacrifice Carrion Feeder to activate its own ability. The ability will have no effect as it resolves.

card.name: Centaur Chieftain
card.ability: Haste£#_Threshold_# — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Centaur Chieftain has "When Centaur Chieftain enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn."
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : All creatures under your control when Centaur Chieftain’s triggered ability resolves are affected, including Centaur Chieftain itself. Ones that come under your control or become creatures later in the turn are not.£6/8/2016 : If you don’t have enough cards in your graveyard at the moment Centaur Chieftain enters the battlefield, its threshold ability won’t trigger. If the number of cards in your graveyard changes and Centaur Chieftain loses the ability once it has triggered, the ability will still resolve.

card.name: Cephalid Sage
card.ability: #_Threshold_# — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Cephalid Sage has "When Cephalid Sage enters the battlefield, draw three cards, then discard two cards."
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You draw three cards and discard two cards all while Cephalid Sage’s ability is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.£6/8/2016 : If you don’t have enough cards in your graveyard at the moment Cephalid Sage enters the battlefield, its threshold ability won’t trigger. If the number of cards in your graveyard changes and Cephalid Sage loses the ability once it has triggered, the ability will still resolve.

card.name: Chain Lightning
card.ability: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Then that player or that creature's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.
card.ruling: £10/4/2004 : The copy is a spell, so it can be targeted by other spells and abilities that target a spell.£10/4/2004 : The player putting the copy spell on the stack controls that spell.£10/4/2004 : The spell copy has all the text and can result in itself being copied.£6/8/2016 : As Chain Lightning resolves, the targeted player or the controller of the targeted creature may copy it. The copy has the same text, target, and color of the resolving spell, though the player who’s copying it may choose a new target for it. Once that copy is created (or not), the first Chain Lightning has finished resolving and leaves the stack.£6/8/2016 : The player putting the copy of the spell on the stack controls that copy.£6/8/2016 : The copy of Chain Lightning is created on the stack, so it’s not cast. Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won’t trigger. Players may respond to that spell before it resolves.£6/8/2016 : If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target when Chain Lightning tries to resolve, the spell is countered. It can’t be copied.

card.name: Chrome Mox
card.ability: #_Imprint_# — When Chrome Mox enters the battlefield, you may exile a nonartifact, nonland card from your hand.£{T}: Add one mana of any of the exiled card's colors to your mana pool.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If no card is imprinted on Chrome Mox, it can’t add mana to your mana pool. It can never add colorless mana to your mana pool, even if the imprinted card has a colorless mana symbol in its mana cost.£6/8/2016 : If you imprinted a multicolored card, you choose one of that card’s colors each time Chrome Mox’s ability resolves.

card.name: Civic Wayfinder
card.ability: When Civic Wayfinder enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.flavor: #_"These alleys are not safe. Come, I can guide you back to the market square."_#

card.name: Coalition Honor Guard
card.ability: While choosing targets as part of casting a spell or activating an ability, your opponents must choose at least one Flagbearer on the battlefield if able.
card.flavor: #_Giving little thought to their own defense, they carried the flag that united their army._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Any player’s Flagbearer may be targeted. For example, if each player controls a Coalition Honor Guard, Seal of Strength’s ability may target any of them.£6/8/2016 : Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text. Triggered abilities (written with “when,” “whenever,” or “at”) don’t have to target a Flagbearer.£6/8/2016 : If a spell or ability’s targets are changed, or if a copy of a spell or ability is put onto the stack and has new targets chosen, it doesn’t have to target a Flagbearer.

card.name: Commune with the Gods
card.ability: Reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature or enchantment card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
card.flavor: #_For the first time in many years, Elspeth asked for help._#

card.name: Control Magic
card.ability: Enchant creature£You control enchanted creature.
card.flavor: #_If you don't have the best toys, find the one who does._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Gaining control of a creature doesn’t cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.

card.name: Crater Hellion
card.ability: Echo {4}{R}{R} #_(At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)_#£When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.

card.name: Dack Fayden
card.ability: +1: Target player draws two cards, then discards two cards.£−2: Gain control of target artifact.£−6: You get an emblem with "Whenever you cast a spell that targets one or more permanents, gain control of those permanents."
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The targeted player draws two cards and discards two cards all while Dack’s first ability is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.£6/8/2016 : The ability of Dack’s emblem will resolve before the spell that caused it to trigger.£6/8/2016 : The effect of Dack’s second ability and the effect of the emblem’s ability last indefinitely. You won’t lose control of the permanents if Dack leaves the battlefield.£6/8/2016 : If you gain control of a permanent, and you leave the game, the control-changing effect will end. Unless there’s another control-changing effect affecting that permanent, it will return to its owner’s control.£6/8/2016 : If you gain control of a permanent another player owns, and that player leaves the game, the permanent will also leave the game.

card.name: Daze
card.ability: You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay Daze's mana cost.£Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If another effect causes Daze to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

card.name: Deadbridge Shaman
card.ability: When Deadbridge Shaman dies, target opponent discards a card.
card.flavor: #_Ending her life won't end the infestation._#

card.name: Deathrite Shaman
card.ability: {T}: Exile target land card from a graveyard. Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.£{B}, {T}: Exile target instant or sorcery card from a graveyard. Each opponent loses 2 life.£{G}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain 2 life.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Because the first ability requires a target, it is not a mana ability. It uses the stack and can be responded to.£6/8/2016 : If the target of any of Deathrite Shaman’s three abilities is an illegal target when that ability tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won’t add mana to your mana pool, no opponent will lose life, or you won’t gain life, as appropriate.

card.name: Deep Analysis
card.ability: Target player draws two cards.£Flashback—{1}{U}, Pay 3 life. #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_"No fact escapes me. Why do you think you can?"_#

card.name: Desperate Ravings
card.ability: Draw two cards, then discard a card at random.£Flashback {2}{U} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_Her mind was quite gone, yet she spoke nothing but truth._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You draw two cards and discard one randomly all while Desperate Ravings is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

card.name: Diminishing Returns
card.ability: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You exile the top ten cards of your library. Then each player draws up to seven cards.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Each player chooses to draw any number of cards from zero to seven. First the player whose turn it is chooses how many cards to draw, then draws those cards, then each other player in turn order does the same.£6/8/2016 : Diminishing Returns won’t be put into your graveyard until after it’s finished resolving, which means it won’t be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.£6/8/2016 : The exiled cards are exiled face up. You’ll see them before you choose how many cards to draw.

card.name: Dismal Backwater
card.ability: Dismal Backwater enters the battlefield tapped.£When Dismal Backwater enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Dragon Egg
card.ability: Defender #_(This creature can't attack.)_#£When Dragon Egg dies, create a 2/2 red Dragon creature token with flying. It has "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
card.flavor: #_Dragon birth lairs are littered with treasure to entice the young from their eggs._#

card.name: Dream Twist
card.ability: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.£Flashback {1}{U} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#

card.name: Dualcaster Mage
card.ability: Flash£When Dualcaster Mage enters the battlefield, copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
card.flavor: #_"It has been my experience that disasters like to strike in pairs."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Dualcaster Mage’s triggered ability can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets. It doesn’t matter who controls it.£6/8/2016 : As Dualcaster Mage’s triggered ability resolves, it creates a copy of a spell on the stack. The copy isn’t cast, so abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won’t trigger.£6/8/2016 : The copy will have the same targets as the spell it’s copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can’t choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).£6/8/2016 : You can’t choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional or alternative costs paid for the targeted spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy.£6/8/2016 : If the spell is modal (that is, it says “Choose one —” or the like), the copy will have the same mode. You can’t choose a different one.£6/8/2016 : If the spell has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.£6/8/2016 : If the copy says that it affects “you,” it affects the controller of the copy, not the controller of the original spell. Similarly, if the copy says that it affects an “opponent,” it affects an opponent of the copy’s controller, not an opponent of the original spell’s controller.

card.name: Duplicant
card.ability: #_Imprint_# — When Duplicant enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature.£As long as a card exiled with Duplicant is a creature card, Duplicant has the power, toughness, and creature types of the last creature card exiled with Duplicant. It's still a Shapeshifter.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If no creature card is imprinted on Duplicant, it has its normal power, toughness, and creature type.£6/8/2016 : Duplicant’s base power and toughness change to the imprinted card’s power and toughness. Counters and other effects that modify Duplicant’s power and toughness still apply.£6/8/2016 : Abilities that define a creature’s power and toughness apply while that card is in exile, but abilities that add or subtract from it don’t. For example, the ability of Battle Squadron applies to determine Duplicant’s power and toughness, but the ability of Werebear doesn’t. Duplicant’s power and toughness are constantly updated if the exiled card’s power and/or toughness change.£6/8/2016 : Duplicant keeps all creature types it had when the card was imprinted, including any types that Duplicant had gained.£7/13/2016 : If a melded permanent is exiled by Duplicant’s triggered ability, that ability’s controller chooses the relative timestamp of the two meld cards. Duplicant looks at the information of the one with the later timestamp.

card.name: Duress
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: #_"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."£—Liliana Vess_#

card.name: Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
card.ability: {1}{W}: Target permanent you control gains protection from white until end of turn.£{1}: Target spell or permanent becomes white until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"Virtue is an inner light that can prevail in every soul."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : A permanent spell that becomes white this way will enter the battlefield and continue to be white until end of turn.

card.name: Elephant Guide
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.£When enchanted creature dies, create a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If Elephant Guide enchants an opponent’s creature, you get the Elephant when that creature dies.

card.name: Elite Vanguard
card.flavor: #_The vanguard is skilled at waging war alone. The enemy is often defeated before its reinforcements reach the front._#

card.name: Elvish Vanguard
card.ability: Whenever another Elf enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Vanguard.
card.flavor: #_"Our lives are woven together like the trees' branches over our heads, forming a canopy that protects us all."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If Elvish Vanguard enters the battlefield at the same time as another Elf, its ability will trigger.

card.name: Emmessi Tome
card.ability: {5}, {T}: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
card.flavor: #_It is like life and destiny: we think we know the story, but we have read only half the tale._#

card.name: Emperor Crocodile
card.ability: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
card.flavor: #_The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Emperor Crocodile’s ability will trigger if you don’t control another creature, even if it’s only for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability (such as that of Brago, King Eternal).£6/8/2016 : The ability only checks if you control no other creatures at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution, so gaining control of a creature before then will not save Emperor Crocodile.

card.name: Enlightened Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.flavor: #_"Organization is often undervalued but rarely unjustified."£—Frasio, royal archivist_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The “shuffle and put the card on top” is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

card.name: Entomb
card.ability: Search your library for a card and put that card into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: #_"I'll return once you've ripened."£—Ghoulcaller Gisa_#

card.name: Extract from Darkness
card.ability: Each player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then put a creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: #_If you want to wreak havoc above, sometimes it's best to look below._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Extract from Darkness doesn’t target a creature card. You choose which card you’re putting onto the battlefield as it resolves. You can choose any creature card in a graveyard at that time, including one just put into a graveyard by Extract from Darkness. If there are no creature cards in graveyards at that time, Extract from Darkness simply finishes resolving.

card.name: Eyeblight's Ending
card.ability: Destroy target non-Elf creature.
card.flavor: #_"Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one."£—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana_#

card.name: Fact or Fiction
card.ability: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You choose which pile to put into your hand.£6/8/2016 : Each pile may contain from zero to five cards; they don’t have to be split “evenly.”

card.name: Faithless Looting
card.ability: Draw two cards, then discard two cards.£Flashback {2}{R} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_"Avacyn has abandoned us! We have nothing left except what we can take!"_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You draw two cards and discard two cards all while Faithless Looting is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

card.name: Faith's Fetters
card.ability: Enchant permanent£When Faith's Fetters enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.£Enchanted permanent's activated abilities can't be activated unless they're mana abilities. If enchanted permanent is a creature, it can't attack or block.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.£6/8/2016 : Faith’s Fetters doesn’t stop static abilities, triggered abilities, or mana abilities from working. A mana ability is an ability that produces mana, not an ability that costs mana.£6/8/2016 : Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

card.name: Fervent Cathar
card.ability: Haste£When Fervent Cathar enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
card.flavor: #_"I'll put my sword down only to die. And I don't plan on doing that today."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The targeted creature can’t block any creatures this turn. The effect doesn’t merely restrict whether it can block Fervent Cathar.

card.name: Field of Souls
card.ability: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : A creature card that you own but don’t control will be put into your graveyard if that creature dies, and Field of Souls’s ability will trigger.

card.name: Firebolt
card.ability: Firebolt deals 2 damage to target creature or player.£Flashback {4}{R} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_"There's more where that came from!"_#

card.name: Flame Jab
card.ability: Flame Jab deals 1 damage to target creature or player.£Retrace #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)_#
card.flavor: #_"Fire's out. Should be safe now."£—Gnarltrunk_#
card.ruling: £8/1/2008 : Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other spell, with two exceptions: You’re casting it from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.£8/1/2008 : A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.£8/1/2008 : When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves or is countered, it’s put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.£8/1/2008 : If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so he or she can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it’s still in the graveyard.

card.name: Flame-Kin Zealot
card.ability: When Flame-Kin Zealot enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Boros soldiers are like a cache of bombs ready to explode, and the flame-kin light their fuses._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : All creatures under your control when Flame-Kin Zealot’s triggered ability resolves are affected, including Flame-Kin Zealot itself. Ones that come under your control or become creatures later in the turn are not.

card.name: Flinthoof Boar
card.ability: Flinthoof Boar gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Mountain.£{R}: Flinthoof Boar gains haste until end of turn. #_(It can attack and {T} this turn.)_#
card.flavor: #_Through the smoke and flames it hunts, sniffing out the panicked and confused._#

card.name: Fog
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.flavor: #_"I fear no army or beast, but only the morning fog. Our assault can survive everything else."£—Lord Hilneth_#

card.name: Force of Will
card.ability: You may pay 1 life and exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay Force of Will's mana cost.£Counter target spell.
card.flavor: #_"I alone determine my destiny."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If another effect causes Force of Will to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

card.name: Future Sight
card.ability: Play with the top card of your library revealed.£You may play the top card of your library.
card.flavor: #_"Is the inevitable any less miraculous?"£—Veldka, wandering sage_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The top card of your library isn’t in your hand, so you can’t suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.£6/8/2016 : You must follow the normal timing permissions and restrictions for the top card of your library and pay its costs. If it has alternative or additional costs, you may pay those. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those.£6/8/2016 : If the top card of your library is a land, you may play that land only if you have any available land plays.£6/8/2016 : If the top card of your library changes while you’re casting a spell or activating an ability (perhaps because that top card is the card you’re casting) the new top card won’t be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.£6/8/2016 : As soon as you finish playing the card on top of your library, reveal the next card in your library.

card.name: Gaea's Blessing
card.ability: Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.£Draw a card.£When Gaea's Blessing is put into your graveyard from your library, shuffle your graveyard into your library.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : When you cast Gaea’s Blessing, you can’t choose it as one of its own targets. This is because you choose the targets when casting this spell, and spells are not put into your graveyard until after they resolve.£6/8/2016 : You must target a player as you cast Gaea’s Blessing. You may target zero, one, two, or three cards in that player’s graveyard.

card.name: Gamble
card.ability: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: #_"What's the worst that can happen?"_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You might end up discarding the card you searched for.£6/8/2016 : You put the card into your hand and discard a card at random all while Gamble is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

card.name: Gaseous Form
card.ability: Enchant creature£Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
card.flavor: #_"It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."£—Ertai, wizard adept_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The enchanted creature can still attack and block.

card.name: Ghitu Slinger
card.ability: Echo {2}{R} #_(At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)_#£When Ghitu Slinger enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Giant Solifuge
card.ability: #_({RG} can be paid with either {R} or {G}.)_#£Trample; haste; shroud #_(This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)_#
card.flavor: #_"If you'd ever met one, you wouldn't ask me to justify the extra provisions for additional security."£—Lorref, caravan master_#

card.name: Giant Tortoise
card.ability: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.
card.flavor: #_In the coastal states of Jhess and Valeron, "tortoise" is a synonym for "stubborn."_#

card.name: Glacial Wall
card.ability: Defender #_(This creature can't attack.)_#
card.flavor: #_"There is no confusion as to the boundary of the archmage's territory."£—Ippin, master cartographer_#

card.name: Glare of Subdual
card.ability: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact or creature.
card.flavor: #_The righteous light of Selesnya is channeled through the devout, striking out to blind the nonbelievers._#

card.name: Glimmerpoint Stag
card.ability: Vigilance£When Glimmerpoint Stag enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If a token is exiled this way, it ceases to exist and won’t return to the battlefield.£6/8/2016 : The exiled card will return to the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step even if Glimmerpoint Stag is no longer on the battlefield at that time.£6/8/2016 : If the exiled card is an Aura, that card’s owner chooses what it will enchant as it comes back onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way doesn’t target anything (so it could be attached to a permanent with shroud, for example), but the Aura’s enchant ability restricts what it can be attached to. If the Aura can’t legally be attached to anything, it remains exiled.£6/8/2016 : If Glimmerpoint Stag somehow enters the battlefield during a turn’s end step, the exiled card won’t be returned to the battlefield until the beginning of the following turn’s end step.

card.name: Goblin Charbelcher
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a land card. Goblin Charbelcher deals damage equal to the number of nonland cards revealed this way to target creature or player. If the revealed land card was a Mountain, Goblin Charbelcher deals double that damage instead. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You must choose a target for Goblin Charbelcher’s ability as you activate it, before you reveal any cards.£6/8/2016 : If you reveal no land cards, Goblin Charbelcher deals damage equal to the number of cards revealed, and then you may order your library as you like.

card.name: Goblin Trenches
card.ability: {2}, Sacrifice a land: Create two 1/1 red and white Goblin Soldier creature tokens.
card.flavor: #_"Even if we dislodge them, I fear these lands will never again yield crops."£—Kimmick, vanguard knight_#
card.ruling: £10/4/2004 : The tokens are named “Goblin Soldier” and have the creature types “Goblin” and “Soldier”.

card.name: Gravedigger
card.ability: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: #_A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves._#
card.ruling: £10/1/2009 : A “creature card” is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

card.name: Green Sun's Zenith
card.ability: Search your library for a green creature card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Shuffle Green Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
card.flavor: #_As the green sun crowned, Phyrexian prophecies glowed on the Tree of Tales._#
card.ruling: £6/1/2011 : If this spell is countered, none of its effects occur. In particular, it will go to the graveyard rather than to its owner’s library.£6/8/2016 : If Green Sun’s Zenith is countered, none of its effects will happen. Notably, it will be put into its owner’s graveyard rather than shuffled into its owner’s library.£6/8/2016 : In most cases, if you own Green Sun’s Zenith and cast it, you’ll shuffle your library twice. In practice, shuffling once is sufficient, but effects that care about you shuffling your library (like Psychogenic Probe, for example) will see that you’ve shuffled twice.£6/8/2016 : If you own Green Sun’s Zenith, but an opponent casts it (due to Knowledge Pool’s effect, for example), that opponent searches his or her library for an appropriate creature card, then shuffles that library. That opponent then shuffles Green Sun’s Zenith into your library. You won’t shuffle any library in this case.

card.name: Harmonize
card.ability: Draw three cards.
card.flavor: #_"Words lie. People lie. The land tells the truth."_#
card.ruling: £2/1/2007 : This is the timeshifted version of Concentrate.

card.name: Havoc Demon
card.ability: Flying£When Havoc Demon dies, all creatures get -5/-5 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_A cry of pain as it enters this world. A chorus of screams as it leaves._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : All creatures on the battlefield when Havoc Demon’s triggered ability resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

card.name: Heritage Druid
card.ability: Tap three untapped Elves you control: Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: #_"Study the great spirits of our age and those of the past. Prune secrets from the branching traceries of our lineage."£—Twila, Gilt-Leaf archdruid_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Since Heritage Druid’s activated ability doesn’t have a tap symbol in its cost, you can tap creatures that haven’t been under your control since your most recent turn began (including Heritage Druid itself) to pay the cost.

card.name: Honden of Cleansing Fire
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 2 life for each Shrine you control.
card.flavor: #_To the sorrow of all, its fire was turned toward those who worshipped it._#

card.name: Honden of Infinite Rage
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, Honden of Infinite Rage deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of Shrines you control.
card.flavor: #_To the sorrow of all, its rage became focused on those who once stoked it._#

card.name: Honden of Life's Web
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token for each Shrine you control.
card.flavor: #_To the sorrow of all, its web became a net that strangled those who helped weave it._#

card.name: Honden of Night's Reach
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent discards a card for each Shrine you control.
card.flavor: #_To the sorrow of all, its dark reach grasped and crushed those who guarded its silent vigil._#

card.name: Honden of Seeing Winds
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card for each Shrine you control.
card.flavor: #_To the sorrow of all, its winds found sin in the hearts of those who once learned from its wisdom._#

card.name: Humble
card.ability: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and has base power and toughness 0/1.
card.flavor: #_Through failure we learn our finest lessons in humility._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Humble overwrites all previous effects that set the creature’s base power and toughness to specific values. Any power- or toughness-setting effects that start to apply after Humble resolves will overwrite this effect.£6/8/2016 : Effects that modify a creature’s power and/or toughness, such as the effect of Seal of Strength, will apply to the creature no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for any counters that change its power and/or toughness and effects that switch its power and toughness.£6/8/2016 : If the affected creature gains an ability after Humble resolves, it will keep that ability.£6/8/2016 : Humble doesn’t counter abilities that have already triggered or been activated. In particular, casting this spell won’t stop a creature’s ability that says “At the beginning of your upkeep,” “When this creature enters the battlefield,” or similar from triggering.

card.name: Hydroblast
card.ability: Choose one —£• Counter target spell if it's red.£• Destroy target permanent if it's red.
card.flavor: #_Fire can be savage, but it is fickle. Water is always true, its flow steady and world-shaping._#
card.ruling: £10/4/2004 : The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can’t be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.£6/8/2016 : Hydroblast can target any spell or permanent, not just a red one. It checks the color of the target only on resolution.

card.name: Hymn to Tourach
card.ability: Target player discards two cards at random.
card.flavor: #_The priests plead for your anguish and pray for your despair._#

card.name: Ichorid
card.ability: Haste£At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ichorid.£At the beginning of your upkeep, if Ichorid is in your graveyard, you may exile a black creature card other than Ichorid from your graveyard. If you do, return Ichorid to the battlefield.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If multiple Ichorids are in your graveyard, you can’t exile the same creature card to return each of them to the battlefield.£6/8/2016 : If one Ichorid’s ability exiles another, the exiled Ichorid’s ability can’t return it to the battlefield.

card.name: Imperious Perfect
card.ability: Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.£{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
card.flavor: #_In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods._#

card.name: Inkwell Leviathan
card.ability: Islandwalk #_(This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)_#£Trample£Shroud #_(This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)_#
card.flavor: #_"Into its maw went the seventh sea, never to be seen again while the world remains."£—Esper fable_#
card.name_JP: 墨溜まりのリバイアサン

card.name: Innocent Blood
card.ability: Each player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor: #_Zombies mourn for the living and celebrate those who will soon be given the gift of death._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You can cast Innocent Blood even if some (or all) players control no creatures. Those players are simply unaffected.

card.name: Intangible Virtue
card.ability: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
card.flavor: #_In life, they were a motley crew: farmers, lords, cutpurses, priests. In death, they are united in singular, benevolent purpose._#

card.name: Invigorate
card.ability: If you control a Forest, rather than pay Invigorate's mana cost, you may have an opponent gain 3 life.£Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If another effect causes Invigorate to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.£6/8/2016 : If an effect says that an opponent can’t gain life, you can’t have that player gain life to pay Invigorate’s alternative cost. If an effect instead replaces life gain, such as that of Sulfuric Vortex, you may choose to pay the cost even though the cost’s action is replaced with nothing.

card.name: Isochron Scepter
card.ability: #_Imprint_# — When Isochron Scepter enters the battlefield, you may exile an instant card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand.£{2}, {T}: You may copy the exiled card. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If the imprinted card leaves the exile zone while the activated ability is on the stack, the copy can’t be made.£6/8/2016 : If Isochron Scepter leaves the battlefield while the activated ability is on the stack, the ability can still make a copy.£6/8/2016 : You cast the copy while the ability is resolving and still on the stack.£6/8/2016 : Because you’re already casting the spell using an alternative cost (by casting it without paying its mana cost), you can’t pay any other alternative costs for the card. You can pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those.£6/8/2016 : If the exiled card has X in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value for X when casting it.£6/8/2016 : You may exile a split card while resolving Isochron Scepter’s imprint ability if either half has a converted mana cost of 2 or less. When you activate the second ability, you may choose to cast either half of the split card, even if one half has a converted mana cost greater than 2, but you may not cast both halves.£6/8/2016 : If you don’t want to cast the copy, you can choose not to; the copy ceases to exist the next time state-based actions are checked.

card.name: Jace, the Mind Sculptor
card.ability: +2: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.£0: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.£−1: Return target creature to its owner's hand.£−12: Exile all cards from target player's library, then that player shuffles his or her hand into his or her library.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Jace’s second ability is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.£6/8/2016 : If the targeted player for Jace’s last ability has no cards in hand, that player shuffles nothing into his or her library, and that player’s library will remain empty. That player won’t lose the game until he or she tries to draw from the empty library.
card.name_JP: 精神を刻む者、ジェイス

card.name: Jareth, Leonine Titan
card.ability: Whenever Jareth, Leonine Titan blocks, it gets +7/+7 until end of turn.£{W}: Jareth gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_Light's champion in the stronghold of darkness._#
card.name_JP: 獅子面のタイタン、ジャレス

card.name: Jetting Glasskite
card.ability: Flying£Whenever Jetting Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time each turn, counter that spell or ability.
card.flavor: #_The bolt struck with a flash, and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed._#

card.name: Juggernaut
card.ability: Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.£Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
card.flavor: #_Many a besieged city has surrendered upon hearing the distinctive rumble of the juggernaut._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If, during your declare attackers step, Juggernaut is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can’t attack, or you haven’t controlled it continuously since the beginning of your turn, then it doesn’t attack. If there’s a cost associated with having Juggernaut attack, you aren’t forced to pay that cost, so it doesn’t have to attack in that case either.£6/8/2016 : If there are multiple combat phases in a turn, Juggernaut must attack only in the first one in which it’s able to.

card.name: Jungle Hollow
card.ability: Jungle Hollow enters the battlefield tapped.£When Jungle Hollow enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.

card.name: Karakas
card.ability: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.£{T}: Return target legendary creature to its owner's hand.

card.name: Karmic Guide
card.ability: Flying, protection from black£Echo {3}{W}{W} #_(At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)_#£When Karmic Guide enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

card.name: Keldon Champion
card.ability: Haste£Echo {2}{R}{R} #_(At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)_#£When Keldon Champion enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target player.
card.name_JP: ケルドのチャンピオン

card.name: Keldon Marauders
card.ability: Vanishing 2 #_(This creature enters the battlefield with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)_#£When Keldon Marauders enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target player.

card.name: Kird Ape
card.ability: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.
card.flavor: #_It puts the "fur" in "fury."_#

card.name: Kor Hookmaster
card.ability: When Kor Hookmaster enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor: #_"For us, a rope represents the ties that bind the kor. For you, it's more literal."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You may target any creature an opponent controls. If it’s already tapped, it just won’t untap during its controller’s next untap step.£6/8/2016 : If the creature isn’t tapped during its controller’s next untap step (perhaps because it was untapped by a spell), this ability has no effect. It won’t apply at a later time.

card.name: Llanowar Elves
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: #_One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.£—Llanowar penalty for trespassing_#

card.name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
card.ability: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
card.flavor: #_From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Lys Alana Huntmaster’s ability will resolve before the Elf spell that caused it to trigger.
card.name_JP: リス・アラナの狩りの達人

card.name: Lys Alana Scarblade
card.ability: {T}, Discard an Elf card: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves you control.
card.flavor: #_In beauty-obsessed Lys Alana, one cut of her blade means the difference between a high society feast and raking through the dungheap for scraps._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The number of Elves you control is counted only as Lys Alana Scarblade’s ability resolves. If Lys Alana Scarblade is still on the battlefield, it’ll count itself.

card.name: Maelstrom Wanderer
card.ability: Creatures you control have haste.£Cascade, cascade #_(When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order. Then do it again.)_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Maelstrom Wanderer gives itself haste.£6/8/2016 : Each instance of cascade triggers and resolves separately. The spell you cast due to the first cascade ability will go on the stack on top of the second cascade ability. That spell will resolve before you exile cards for the second cascade ability.£6/8/2016 : No matter what spell you cast with the first cascade trigger (or with any cascade triggers that result from casting that spell), the second cascade trigger will look for a spell with converted mana cost less than Maelstrom Wanderer’s converted mana cost of 8.

card.name: Malicious Affliction
card.ability: #_Morbid_# — When you cast Malicious Affliction, if a creature died this turn, you may copy Malicious Affliction and may choose a new target for the copy.£Destroy target nonblack creature.
card.flavor: #_"Such an affliction appears to seek out the pure."£—Byro, plague doctor_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The copy of Malicious Affliction is created on the stack. It’s not cast, so the copy won’t cause the morbid ability to trigger again.£6/8/2016 : The copy will have the same target as the original spell unless you choose a new one. You don’t have to change this target if you don’t want to or can’t choose a new legal target (perhaps because there are no other nonblack creatures on the battlefield).

card.name: Mana Crypt
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Mana Crypt deals 3 damage to you.£{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : No player may choose to take actions between determining the result of the flip and damage being dealt if you lost the flip.

card.name: Man-o'-War
card.ability: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: #_"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."£—Naimah, Femeref philosopher_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o’-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

card.name: Maze of Ith
card.ability: {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Maze of Ith can target an untapped attacking creature. It will still prevent damage in that case.£6/8/2016 : The creature isn’t removed from combat; it just has its damage prevented. It’s still an attacking creature until the combat phase is complete.£6/8/2016 : You can activate Maze of Ith’s ability targeting an attacking creature you control during the combat damage step or the end of combat step. It’ll be untapped and the damage it had already dealt won’t be undone.

card.name: Memory Lapse
card.ability: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
card.flavor: #_What a lonely agony, the memory of memories lost._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Memory Lapse has a self-replacement effect that replaces the spell going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If the spell was cast using flashback, however, flashback will change the spell’s destination from its owner’s library to exile.

card.name: Merfolk Looter
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: #_Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it._#
card.name_JP: マーフォークの物あさり

card.name: Mesa Enchantress
card.ability: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"Scholars seek to understand the way the world is. I wish to shape the world into what it should be."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Mesa Enchantress’s last ability will resolve before the spell that caused it to trigger.£6/8/2016 : If the enchantment spell is countered, Mesa Enchantress’s last ability still resolves and causes you to draw a card.£6/8/2016 : Enchantments put onto the battlefield without being cast won’t cause Mesa Enchantress’s last ability to trigger.

card.name: Millikin
card.ability: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: Add {C} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: #_The toymaker frowned in bewilderment. None of his creations had ever sneezed before._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If you activate Millikin’s ability while casting a spell, you can’t choose to rewind the ability once you see the card that was put into your graveyard.

card.name: Mindless Automaton
card.ability: Mindless Automaton enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.£{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.£Remove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.

card.name: Mishra's Factory
card.ability: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.£{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.£{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling: £8/1/2005 : If another player takes control of the Factory while it is animated, that player keeps control until the control effect ends. They do not lose control just because the card stops being an Assembly-Worker. Note that Auras which steal cards will go to the graveyard if the permanent they enchant is no longer valid.£8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.£10/1/2009 : Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it’s already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.£6/8/2016 : Once turned into a creature, Mishra’s Factory’s last ability can target itself. If it’s already blocking, this won’t remove it from combat.£6/8/2016 : If you turn Mishra’s Factory into a creature but haven’t controlled it continuously since your most recent turn began, you won’t be able to activate its first or last ability.

card.name: Mistral Charger
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: #_Some sky steeds break from the thundering herd to ride free on the open winds._#

card.name: Mogg Fanatic
card.ability: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: #_"I got it! I got it! I—"_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Once Mogg Fanatic has dealt and been dealt combat damage, it’s too late to activate its ability before it’s destroyed.

card.name: Mogg War Marshal
card.ability: Echo {1}{R} #_(At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)_#£When Mogg War Marshal enters the battlefield or dies, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token.

card.name: Monk Idealist
card.ability: When Monk Idealist enters the battlefield, return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: #_"Belief is the strongest mortar."_#

card.name: Mother of Runes
card.ability: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_She will not touch a weapon, yet she is the greatest protector her people have ever known._#

card.name: Mystical Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.flavor: #_The student searches the world for meaning. The master finds worlds of meaning in the search._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The “shuffle and put the card on top” is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

card.name: Natural Order
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Natural Order, sacrifice a green creature.£Search your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: #_. . . but the price of Mangara's freedom was Asmira's life._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Sacrificing a green creature is part of Natural Order’s cost. You can’t sacrifice more creatures to search for more creature cards, and you can’t cast Natural Order at all if you control no green creatures.£6/8/2016 : Players can respond to this spell only after it's been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to stop you from casting this spell or to make you sacrifice a different one.

card.name: Nature's Claim
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Its controller gains 4 life.
card.flavor: #_"The timeless, tireless jaws of nature shall one day devour us all."£—Sildark, artificer of Omu_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If the targeted artifact or enchantment is an illegal target when Nature’s Claim tries to resolve, the entire spell is countered. No one gains any life.

card.name: Nausea
card.ability: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"Was it something I said?"_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : All creatures on the battlefield when Nausea resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

card.name: Necropotence
card.ability: Skip your draw step.£Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.£Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Necropotence’s last ability creates a delayed triggered ability that will put the exiled card into your hand. That ability still triggers even if Necropotence is removed from the battlefield before your end step.£6/8/2016 : If the discarded card isn’t put into your graveyard (due to an effect such as madness) or leaves your graveyard (perhaps because another effect returned it to your hand), it won’t be exiled.

card.name: Nekrataal
card.ability: First strike£When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: #_His victims don't have time to feel despair._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it’s a creature you control.

card.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
card.ability: Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped.£{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You don’t sacrifice Nevinyrral’s Disk to activate its ability. It’s destroyed as part of the ability’s resolution if it’s still on the battlefield. If an effect gives Nevinyrral’s Disk indestructible or regenerates it, it stays on the battlefield.

card.name: Night's Whisper
card.ability: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
card.flavor: #_"I have seen things that would reduce a weaker person to blubbering and raving. Want to hear about them?"£—Vraska_#

card.name: Nimble Mongoose
card.ability: Shroud #_(This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)_#£#_Threshold_# — Nimble Mongoose gets +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: #_One thread connected all the travelers' stories: the ferocity of the mongoose._#

card.name: Oona's Grace
card.ability: Target player draws a card.£Retrace #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)_#
card.flavor: #_Oona grants her favored subjects a dream from her own guarded heart._#
card.ruling: £8/1/2008 : Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other spell, with two exceptions: You’re casting it from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.£8/1/2008 : A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.£8/1/2008 : When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves or is countered, it’s put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.£8/1/2008 : If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so he or she can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it’s still in the graveyard.

card.name: Orcish Oriflamme
card.ability: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
card.flavor: #_The orcs' banner sends a clear message: "Stand against us and meet the same fate as the goblins."_#

card.name: Pacifism
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
card.flavor: #_For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside._#

card.name: Peregrine Drake
card.ability: Flying£When Peregrine Drake enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.
card.flavor: #_"Always a welcome sight breaking through the clouds."£—Talrand, sky summoner_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You choose which lands to untap as the triggered ability resolves. They aren’t targeted, and they don’t have to be lands that you control.

card.name: Phantom Monster
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: #_Is it an amalgamation of faded memories or the projection of a half-remembered dream? Neither answer offers any comfort._#

card.name: Phyrexian Gargantua
card.ability: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
card.flavor: #_Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua._#
card.name_JP: ファイレクシアのガルガンチュア

card.name: Phyrexian Ingester
card.ability: #_Imprint_# — When Phyrexian Ingester enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature.£Phyrexian Ingester gets +X/+Y, where X is the exiled creature card's power and Y is its toughness.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Phyrexian Ingester will get bonuses based on the card’s power and toughness in exile. Counters, Auras, and Equipment it had on it before it was exiled won’t add to those numbers.£6/8/2016 : Abilities that define a creature’s power and toughness apply while that card is in exile, but abilities that add or subtract from it don’t. For example, the ability of Battle Squadron applies to determine Phyrexian Ingester’s power and toughness, but the ability of Werebear doesn’t. Phyrexian Ingester’s power and toughness are constantly updated if the exiled card’s power and/or toughness change.£6/8/2016 : If the card in exile isn’t a creature card (perhaps because it was a land that was temporarily a creature while on the battlefield), Phyrexian Ingester doesn’t get a bonus.
card.name_JP: ファイレクシアの摂取者

card.name: Phyrexian Rager
card.ability: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
card.flavor: #_"I believe many worlds will bow to Phyrexia. Mirrodin is merely the first."£—Sheoldred, Whispering One_#
card.name_JP: ファイレクシアの憤怒鬼

card.name: Pilgrim's Eye
card.ability: Flying£When Pilgrim's Eye enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: #_The kor send their thopter kites to see if the land is in a welcoming mood._#

card.name: Plague Witch
card.ability: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"I can ail what cures you."_#

card.name: Price of Progress
card.ability: Price of Progress deals damage to each player equal to twice the number of nonbasic lands that player controls.
card.flavor: #_Enthusiasm can be tempered in the furnace of the earth._#

card.name: Prismatic Lens
card.ability: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.£{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: #_It bends not light but mana, aligning its chaotic currents into the sharp angles necessary for the mystic's purposes._#

card.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
card.ability: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: #_"You can't learn to enjoy life's amusements in the pages of books. You must seek them out in earnest."_#

card.name: Prowling Pangolin
card.ability: When Prowling Pangolin enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice two creatures. If a player does, sacrifice Prowling Pangolin.
card.flavor: #_"Wait, are we the decoys?"_#
card.name_JP: うろつくセンザンコウ

card.name: Pyroblast
card.ability: Choose one —£• Counter target spell if it's blue.£• Destroy target permanent if it's blue.
card.flavor: #_Water can be crushing, but it is predictable. Fire is always dynamic, its rage absolute and all-consuming._#
card.ruling: £10/4/2004 : The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can’t be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.£6/8/2016 : Pyroblast can target any spell or permanent, not just a blue one. It checks the color of the target only on resolution.

card.name: Pyrokinesis
card.ability: You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Pyrokinesis's mana cost.£Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The number of targets must be at least one and at most four. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.£6/8/2016 : You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. If any of the targets become illegal, damage is dealt to the other targets as originally assigned. If all targets are illegal, Pyrokinesis is countered.£6/8/2016 : If another effect causes Pyrokinesis to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

card.name: Quiet Speculation
card.ability: Search target player's library for up to three cards with flashback and put them into that player's graveyard. Then the player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor: #_"The best foresight is hindsight."£—Empress Llawan_#

card.name: Raise the Alarm
card.ability: Create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
card.flavor: #_Like blinking or breathing, responding to an alarm is an involuntary reflex._#

card.name: Rally the Peasants
