card.ability: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.£Flashback {2}{R} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_"If you must go out at night, bring a mob."£—Master of the Elgaud Cathars_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Only creatures you control when Rally the Peasants resolves will be affected. Creatures that enter the battlefield or that you gain control of later in the turn will not.

card.name: Rancor
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.£When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If the target of Rancor when it’s cast as a spell is an illegal target when Rancor tries to resolve, Rancor will be countered and put into its owner’s graveyard. It won’t return to its owner’s hand.

card.name: Reckless Charge
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.£Flashback {2}{R} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#

card.name: Regal Force
card.ability: When Regal Force enters the battlefield, draw a card for each green creature you control.
card.flavor: #_It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If Regal Force is still on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, its ability will count itself.

card.name: Relic of Progenitus
card.ability: {T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard.£{1}, Exile Relic of Progenitus: Exile all cards from all graveyards. Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_Elves believe the hydra-god Progenitus sleeps beneath Naya, feeding on forgotten magics._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If you activate Relic of Progenitus’s first ability, the targeted player chooses which card to exile. The choice is made as the ability resolves.£6/8/2016 : You can activate Relic of Progenitus’s second ability even if no players have any cards in their graveyards. You’ll still draw a card.

card.name: Roar of the Wurm
card.ability: Create a 6/6 green Wurm creature token.£Flashback {3}{G} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#

card.name: Roots
card.ability: Enchant creature without flying£When Roots enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.£Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

card.name: Rorix Bladewing
card.ability: Flying, haste
card.flavor: #_In an attempt to restore pride to Shiv and to forge an undying legacy, Rorix traveled far to compete for glory in Otaria's Grand Coliseum._#

card.name: Rugged Highlands
card.ability: Rugged Highlands enters the battlefield tapped.£When Rugged Highlands enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

card.name: Scoured Barrens
card.ability: Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.£When Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Screeching Skaab
card.ability: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
card.flavor: #_Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind._#

card.name: Seal of Cleansing
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Cleansing: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: #_"Find the dens of evil and flood them with light."£—Hulo, the Penitent Wanderer_#
card.ruling: £10/4/2004 : This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Seal of Strength
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Strength: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_When does majestic become ominous?_#

card.name: Second Thoughts
card.ability: Exile target attacking creature.£Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_It suddenly dawned on Jorin that farming was quite a noble profession._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target when Second Thoughts tries to resolve, the entire spell is countered. You won’t draw a card.

card.name: Seismic Stomp
card.ability: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
card.flavor: #_"It is not in me to tread lightly."£—Ryda, geomancer_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : No creature without flying will be able to block that turn, including creatures that lose flying after Seismic Stomp resolves and creatures without flying that enter the battlefield after Seismic Stomp resolves.

card.name: Sengir Autocrat
card.ability: When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, create three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens.£When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.
card.flavor: #_"The penalty for idleness is death. The penalty for disputing the penalty is death."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Sengir Autocrat’s last ability exiles all Serf tokens, not just the Serf tokens its first ability created.£6/8/2016 : If Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield while its first ability is on the stack, its second ability triggers and exiles any Serf tokens that happen to be on the battlefield, and then its first ability resolves and gives you three Serf tokens.

card.name: Sensei's Divining Top
card.ability: {1}: Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.£{T}: Draw a card, then put Sensei's Divining Top on top of its owner's library.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Sensei’s Divining Top’s second ability may be activated in response to its first ability. If so, you’ll draw a card, put Sensei’s Divining Top on top of your library, and then look at the top three cards and rearrange them.£6/8/2016 : If Sensei’s Divining Top leaves the battlefield while its second ability is on the stack, you’ll draw a card and leave Sensei’s Divining Top in the zone it’s moved to.

card.name: Sentinel Spider
card.ability: Vigilance #_(Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)_#£Reach #_(This creature can block creatures with flying.)_#
card.flavor: #_"Your first reaction may be to stand very still and hope she didn't see you. Trust me, she did."£—Endril, Kalonian naturalist_#

card.name: Serendib Efreet
card.ability: Flying£At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.
card.flavor: #_Summoners of efreeti remember only the power of command, never the sting of regret._#
card.name_JP: セレンディブのイフリート

card.name: Serra Angel
card.ability: Flying #_(This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)_#£Vigilance #_(Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)_#
card.flavor: #_Follow the light. In its absence, follow her._#

card.name: Shaman of the Pack
card.ability: When Shaman of the Pack enters the battlefield, target opponent loses life equal to the number of Elves you control.
card.flavor: #_To the elves, her spear is a compass; to the boggarts, a harbinger of doom._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Count the number of Elves you control as Shaman of the Pack’s ability resolves, including Shaman of the Pack if it’s still on the battlefield, to determine how much life is lost.

card.name: Shardless Agent
card.ability: Cascade #_(When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)_#

card.name: Shelter
card.ability: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.£Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_Good strategists seize opportunities. Great strategists make their own._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The legality of a spell’s target is checked only as that spell begins to resolve. If Shelter gives the targeted creature protection from white, you’ll still draw a card.

card.name: Shoreline Ranger
card.ability: Flying£Islandcycling {2} #_({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for an Island card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)_#

card.name: Siege-Gang Commander
card.ability: When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.£{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Siege-Gang Commander’s activated ability, not just the ones its triggered ability puts onto the battlefield. You can even sacrifice Siege-Gang Commander itself.£6/8/2016 : If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking Goblin during the declare blockers step, it won’t deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that Goblin has been dealt lethal damage, it’ll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.

card.name: Silent Departure
card.ability: Return target creature to its owner's hand.£Flashback {4}{U} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#
card.flavor: #_The same magic that lets geists pass through our realm can force them out of it._#

card.name: Silvos, Rogue Elemental
card.ability: Trample£{G}: Regenerate Silvos, Rogue Elemental.
card.flavor: #_He was born of the Mirari, thrust out of his homeland before he was even aware. Left without purpose or meaning, he found both in the pits._#
card.name_JP: 悪辣な精霊シルヴォス

card.name: Sinkhole
card.ability: Destroy target land.
card.flavor: #_High walls, a sturdy keep, a strong garrison . . . they made no difference. In a matter of moments, the city was lost._#

card.name: Skulking Ghost
card.ability: Flying£When Skulking Ghost becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
card.flavor: #_"They exist only so long as the living take no notice."£—Kifimbo, Shadow guildmage_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You’ll sacrifice Skulking Ghost even if you counter the spell or ability that targets it. If that spell has no other targets, it’ll be countered when it tries to resolve.

card.name: Sneak Attack
card.ability: {R}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice the creature at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: £5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.£6/8/2016 : You only sacrifice the creature if you still control it at end of turn. If that creature has left the battlefield, even if it came back, you don’t sacrifice it. Likewise, if an opponent has gained control of it, it won’t be sacrificed and will remain on the battlefield indefinitely.£6/8/2016 : Putting a card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to, even if you have one in your hand.

card.name: Soulcatcher
card.ability: Flying£Whenever a creature with flying dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Soulcatcher.
card.flavor: #_"Their spirits walk the winds and fill my soul."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If another creature with flying is dealt lethal damage at the same time as Soulcatcher, they’ll be destroyed at the same time. Soulcatcher’s ability won’t save it.

card.name: Sphinx of the Steel Wind
card.ability: Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green
card.flavor: #_No one has properly answered her favorite riddle: "Why should I spare your life?"_#
card.name_JP: 鋼の風のスフィンクス

card.name: Sprite Noble
card.ability: Flying£Other creatures you control with flying get +0/+1.£{T}: Other creatures you control with flying get +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"By thorn and by stone, we will fight to see the day when beauty returns to this world."_#

card.name: Squadron Hawk
card.ability: Flying£When Squadron Hawk enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Squadron Hawk, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Stingscourger
card.ability: Echo {3}{R} #_(At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)_#£When Stingscourger enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

card.name: Stupefying Touch
card.ability: Enchant creature£When Stupefying Touch enters the battlefield, draw a card.£Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be activated.
card.flavor: #_"A warrior without wit is simply meat."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.£6/8/2016 : Unlike many similar abilities, Stupefying Touch’s last ability stops mana abilities from being activated.

card.name: Sulfuric Vortex
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.£If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.

card.name: Swiftwater Cliffs
card.ability: Swiftwater Cliffs enters the battlefield tapped.£When Swiftwater Cliffs enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

card.name: Swords to Plowshares
card.ability: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
card.flavor: #_The smallest seed of regret can bloom into redemption._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.£6/8/2016 : If the creature’s power is negative, its controller doesn’t lose or gain life.

card.name: Sylvan Library
card.ability: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw two additional cards. If you do, choose two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put the card on top of your library.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You always perform your normal draw before this ability. The normal draw occurs before anything can be placed on the stack during a player’s draw step.£6/8/2016 : If you control other triggered abilities that allow you to draw cards during your draw step, you can choose to order Sylvan Library’s ability before or after those abilities. Triggered abilities controlled by other players will resolve before triggered abilities you control.£6/8/2016 : Any cards drawn prior to Sylvan Library’s ability resolving, including in your upkeep or in response to Sylvan Library’s triggered ability, can be chosen to be put back using this effect. Sylvan Library’s controller is responsible for keeping these cards distinguishable in hand, such as by keeping them separate from cards that began the turn in hand.£6/8/2016 : If you control more than one Sylvan Library, the triggered ability of each will resolve in sequence. You don’t get to draw all the cards at once and then put them all back at once.£6/8/2016 : You can put back zero, one, or two cards.£6/8/2016 : If you choose to draw two cards, then replace one or more of those draws with some other effect, the rest of Sylvan Library’s ability still happens. If you’ve actually drawn only one card that turn, you must choose that card and either pay 4 life or put it on top of your library. If you haven’t actually drawn any cards that turn, the rest of the ability has no effect.£6/8/2016 : It’s not possible to take any actions between drawing the cards and choosing two cards. You can’t cast the cards you drew to avoid having two cards to choose.

card.name: Sylvan Might
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.£Flashback {2}{G}{G} #_(You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)_#

card.name: Thornweald Archer
card.ability: Reach #_(This creature can block creatures with flying.)_#£Deathtouch #_(Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)_#
card.flavor: #_Their arrows are tipped with basilisk eyes and fletched with cockatrice feathers._#
card.name_JP: ソーンウィールドの射手

card.name: Thornwood Falls
card.ability: Thornwood Falls enters the battlefield tapped.£When Thornwood Falls enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

card.name: Thunderclap Wyvern
card.ability: Flash #_(You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)_#£Flying£Other creatures you control with flying get +1/+1.
card.flavor: #_Thunder doesn't always mean rain. Sometimes it means ruin._#

card.name: Ticking Gnomes
card.ability: Echo {3} #_(At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)_#£Sacrifice Ticking Gnomes: Ticking Gnomes deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Tidal Wave
card.ability: Create a 5/5 blue Wall creature token with defender. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: #_"The floor of the sea is paved with the shattered remnants of vessels that navigated its surface unwelcomed."£—Thassa, god of the sea_#

card.name: Timberwatch Elf
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_"If you ever want to leave this forest, now's the time."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The number of Elves on the battlefield is counted only as Timberwatch Elf’s ability resolves. If Timberwatch Elf is still on the battlefield, it’ll count itself.

card.name: Tooth and Claw
card.ability: Sacrifice two creatures: Create a 3/1 red Beast creature token named Carnivore.
card.flavor: #_"Don't spend long examining signs of its passage. That you find them at all means it's still close at hand."£—Varra, Warden of the East Road_#

card.name: Torrent of Souls
card.ability: Return up to one target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield if {B} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. Creatures target player controls get +2/+0 and gain haste until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. #_(Do both if {B}{R} was spent.)_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : This spell cares about what mana was spent to pay its total cost, not just what mana was spent to pay the hybrid mana symbol in its cost.£6/8/2016 : This spell checks on resolution to see if any mana of the appropriate colors were spent to pay its cost. It doesn’t matter how much mana of that color was spent; the effect isn’t multiplied.£6/8/2016 : If this spell is copied, the copy will not have had any colors of mana paid for it, no matter what colors were spent on the original spell.

card.name: Toxic Deluge
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Toxic Deluge, pay X life.£All creatures get -X/-X until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"It's a difficult task to quarantine a plague that moves with the clouds."£—Esara, healer adept_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The payment of life is an additional cost. You lose the life even if Toxic Deluge is countered.£6/8/2016 : If you cast Toxic Deluge without paying its mana cost, you’ll still choose a value for X and pay X life. This is because it doesn’t have {X} in its mana cost.£6/8/2016 : All creatures on the battlefield when Toxic Deluge resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

card.name: Tragic Slip
card.ability: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.£#_Morbid_# — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if a creature died this turn.
card.flavor: #_Linger on death's door and risk being invited in._#

card.name: Tranquil Cove
card.ability: Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield tapped.£When Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

card.name: Trygon Predator
card.ability: Flying£Whenever Trygon Predator deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment that player controls.
card.flavor: #_Held aloft by metabolized magic, trygons are ravenous for sources of mystic fuel._#

card.name: Twisted Abomination
card.ability: {B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.£Swampcycling {2} #_({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn’t allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.£6/8/2016 : Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.£6/8/2016 : Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.£6/8/2016 : You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

card.name: Undying Rage
card.ability: Enchant creature£Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.£When Undying Rage is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Undying Rage to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If the target of Undying Rage when it’s cast as a spell is an illegal target when Undying Rage tries to resolve, Undying Rage will be countered and put into its owner’s graveyard. It won’t return to its owner’s hand.

card.name: Unexpectedly Absent
card.ability: Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library.
card.flavor: #_Once you've been dragged down the currents of time, you'll never quite trust your own permanence again._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : If there are fewer than X cards in that player’s library, put that permanent on the bottom of that library.£6/8/2016 : If you choose 0 as the value for X, put that permanent on top of its owner’s library.

card.name: Urborg Uprising
card.ability: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.£Draw a card.
card.flavor: #_In Urborg, few things are less permanent than death._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You can cast Urborg Uprising with zero targets if you only want to draw a card.£6/8/2016 : If you chose at least one target and all targets are illegal on resolution, you won’t draw a card.
card.name_JP: 立ち上がるアーボーグ

card.name: Vampiric Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
card.flavor: #_True power is achieved through blood and sweat. But mostly blood._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The “shuffle and put the card on top” is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

card.name: Victimize
card.ability: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor: #_"Die. But die knowing that your pathetic life will yield a great bounty for me."£—Zul Ashur, lich lord_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You must choose two targets. You can’t cast Victimize targeting only one creature card.£6/8/2016 : The creature you sacrifice isn’t chosen until Victimize resolves. You can’t return the creature you sacrifice because it will still be on the battlefield at the time targets are chosen.£6/8/2016 : As Victimize resolves, you must sacrifice a creature if able. You can’t change your mind and choose not to sacrifice anything.£6/8/2016 : If one of the targeted creature cards is an illegal target (for instance, because it has left your graveyard before Victimize resolves), you’ll still sacrifice a creature and put the other card onto the battlefield. If both are illegal targets, Victimize will be countered. You won’t sacrifice a creature.£6/8/2016 : Victimize can be used to put both parts of the B.F.M. onto the battlefield at once.

card.name: Vindicate
card.ability: Destroy target permanent.
card.flavor: #_"I have seen entire civilizations rise and fall. You mortals are but dust to me."£—Sorin Markov_#

card.name: Visara the Dreadful
card.ability: Flying£{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: #_"My eyes are my strongest feature."_#
card.name_JP: 戦慄をなす者ヴィザラ

card.name: Void
card.ability: Choose a number. Destroy all artifacts and creatures with converted mana cost equal to that number. Then target player reveals his or her hand and discards all nonland cards with converted mana cost equal to the number.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You can choose 0. Artifact lands and most tokens have converted mana costs of 0, for example.£6/8/2016 : The target player is chosen as you announce Void, but the number isn’t chosen until it’s resolving. No player may choose to take actions between you choosing a number and the rest of Void’s effects.

card.name: Wake of Vultures
card.ability: Flying£{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Wake of Vultures.
card.flavor: #_"So the vulture said to the griffin, ‘You gonna eat that?'"£—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You can sacrifice Wake of Vultures to activate its own ability. The ability will have no effect as it resolves.

card.name: Wakedancer
card.ability: #_Morbid_# — When Wakedancer enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
card.flavor: #_Hers is an ancient form of necromancy, steeped in shamanic trance and ritual that few skaberen or ghoulcallers comprehend._#

card.name: Wall of Omens
card.ability: Defender£When Wall of Omens enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: #_"I search for a vision of Zendikar that does not include the Eldrazi."£—Expedition journal entry_#

card.name: War Priest of Thune
card.ability: When War Priest of Thune enters the battlefield, you may destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor: #_"Let nothing take away from the purity of swords clashing or of arrows taking flight toward the breast of evil."_#

card.name: Warden of Evos Isle
card.ability: Flying£Creature spells with flying you cast cost {1} less to cast.
card.flavor: #_On Evos Isle, the swift and formidable aven enforce the will of the ruling sphinxes._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : A creature spell that doesn’t have flying won’t cost less even if the creature it will become will have flying once on the battlefield. For example, if you control an Island and Wonder is in your graveyard, creature spells won’t cost {1} less even though those creatures will have flying once they’re on the battlefield.£6/8/2016 : The ability can’t reduce the colored mana requirement of a creature spell with flying.

card.name: Wasteland
card.ability: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.£{T}, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.
card.flavor: #_"The land promises nothing and keeps its promise."£—Oracle en-Vec_#

card.name: Wee Dragonauts
card.ability: Flying£Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Wee Dragonauts gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"The blazekite is a simple concept, really—just a vehicular application of dragscoop ionics and electropropulsion magnetronics."£—Juzba, Izzet tinker_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Wee Dragonauts’s triggered ability will resolve before the spell that caused it to trigger.

card.name: Welkin Guide
card.ability: Flying£When Welkin Guide enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"Those talons really dig into your skin, but it's better than being dropped."£—Rafiq of the Many_#

card.name: Werebear
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.£#_Threshold_# — Werebear gets +3/+3 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: #_To become is to understand._#

card.name: Whitemane Lion
card.ability: Flash #_(You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)_#£When Whitemane Lion enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: #_Saltfield nomads call a sudden storm a "whitemane."_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : You may return this creature itself to its owner’s hand as its triggered ability resolves. If you don't control enough other creatures, you must return it.£6/8/2016 : The ability doesn’t target any creature. You don’t choose what to return until the ability resolves. Once the ability has started to resolve, no one can respond to the choice.
card.name_JP: 白たてがみのライオン

card.name: Wildfire Emissary
card.ability: Protection from white£{1}{R}: Wildfire Emissary gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: #_"The efreet is a striding storm with a voice that crackles like fire."£—Qhattib, vizier of Amiqat_#
card.name_JP: ワイルドファイアの密使

card.name: Wind-Scarred Crag
card.ability: Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield tapped.£When Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.£{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Winter Orb
card.ability: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.
card.flavor: #_"How could anyone survive this? There is some force at work that stifles even the will to go on."£—Naromin, veteran explorer_#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : All permanents untap during a player’s untap step at once. If Winter Orb is tapped as your untap step begins, your lands will all untap.£6/8/2016 : You can’t tap Winter Orb just because you want to. Another ability, such as that of Glare of Subdual, must instruct or allow you to do so.

card.name: Wirewood Symbiote
card.ability: Return an Elf you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: #_"Let the wild in. Channel its strength."£—Freyalise_#
card.name_JP: ワイアウッドの共生虫

card.name: Wonder
card.ability: Flying£As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.
card.flavor: #_"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."£—Scroll of Beginnings_#

card.name: Worldgorger Dragon
card.ability: Flying, trample£When Worldgorger Dragon enters the battlefield, exile all other permanents you control.£When Worldgorger Dragon leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to the battlefield under their owners' control.
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : It is possible for Worldgorger Dragon to leave the battlefield before its “enters the battlefield” trigger resolves. If this happens, then the “leaves the battlefield” trigger will have nothing to return. Then its “enters the battlefield” trigger resolves, and all other permanents you control are exiled forever.£6/8/2016 : If an Aura is exiled with Worldgorger Dragon, the player who controls the Aura when it enters the battlefield chooses what it will enchant. It doesn’t have to go back to the same place. It can’t enter the battlefield enchanting a permanent that enters the battlefield at the same time.£6/8/2016 : If Animate Dead is put onto the battlefield enchanting Worldgorger Dragon, Worldgorger Dragon’s enters-the-battlefield trigger will exile Animate Dead, which causes you to sacrifice Worldgorger Dragon, which causes Animate Dead to return to the battlefield attached to a creature card in a graveyard of your choice. If you can choose a creature card other than Worldgorger Dragon, you must do so after as many iterations of this loop as you’d like. If you can’t choose a different card, and no player chooses to break the loop, the game ends in a draw.
card.name_JP: 世界喰らいのドラゴン

card.name: Worn Powerstone
card.ability: Worn Powerstone enters the battlefield tapped.£{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: #_Even a fragment of a powerstone contains within it not just energy, but space—vast dimensions trapped in fragile crystal._#
card.name_JP: 摩滅したパワーストーン

card.name: Wrath of God
card.ability: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Xantid Swarm
card.ability: Flying£Whenever Xantid Swarm attacks, defending player can't cast spells this turn.
card.flavor: #_When they land on you, all you can think about is tearing them off._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : The defending player may cast spells before Xantid Swarm’s triggered ability resolves.£6/8/2016 : In a multiplayer game, only the player Xantid Swarm attacked is affected. Other defending players may cast spells.

card.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
card.ability: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
card.flavor: #_Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes._#
card.name_JP: ヤヴィマヤの女魔術師

card.name: Young Pyromancer
card.ability: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, create a 1/1 red Elemental creature token.
card.flavor: #_Immolation is the sincerest form of flattery._#
card.ruling: £6/8/2016 : Young Pyromancer’s triggered ability will resolve before the spell that caused it to trigger, but after targets have been chosen for that spell.

card.name: Zealous Persecution
card.ability: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and creatures your opponents control get -1/-1.
card.flavor: #_"Jharic returned from Grixis changed, a haunted look in her eyes. She destroyed them with an unholy glee that made me shudder."£—Knight-Captain Wyhorn_#
